repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• `Q` now repeats a macro for each line of a visual selection.
• `@` now repeats the indicated macro for each line of a visual selection.
```
Idk I find this a bit easier to read.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,9 @@ The following changes may require adaptations in user config or plugins.
 • 'termguicolors' is enabled by default when Nvim is able to determine that
   the host terminal emulator supports 24-bit color.
 
+• `Q` now repeats a macro for each line of visual selection.
+• `@` now repeats the indicated macro for each line of visual selection.

comment_data.body:
Should probably be `:normal!`, unless there's a reason otherwise?

```suggestion
    ':normal! @<c-r>=reg_recorded()<CR><CR>',
    { silent = true, desc = ':help Q' }
  )
  vim.keymap.set(
    'v',
    '@',
    "':normal! @'.getcharstr().'<CR>'",
```

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    'x',
```

"v" maps both Visual _and_ Select mode. To map Visual mode only, use "x".

Mappings with `lhs`es starting with printable characters ought not to be defined for Select mode, as they're expected to replace the selection and enter Insert mode.

comment_data.body:
> Should this be referenced in `:h default-mappings` and have a `v_@-default` tag instead? (And similarly for the others)

Agree, although:

1.  the `v_@-default` part, would be adding the `desc` into the keymap set and adding the tag in the `repeat.txt`, right? (just in case I'm missing something else).
2. how about adding the `v_@-default` tag to the @ section? it would be like the following:
```
							*@* *v_@-default*
@{0-9a-z".=*+}		Execute the contents of register {0-9a-z".=*+} [count]
			times. In Visual mode, repeat the contents of register
			{0-9a-z".=*+} for each selected line.
```

> The "previous" also seems wrong here.

Yes, it's wrong, also going to fix it.

comment_data.body:
1. Yup. That `desc` looks good, thanks!

2. Personally I'd keep it consistent with how other defaults are described.
  Usually the default mapping is mentioned in its own paragraph after the related command, and ends with a link to `|default-mappings|`.

For example, I think the following below the section for `@@` could cover both Visual `@{0-9a-z".=*+}` and `@@`, while remaining relatively clear and short:

```vimdoc
							*v_@-default*
{Visual}@{0-9a-z".=*+}	In Visual mode, execute the contents of the register
{Visual}@@		like "@{0-9a-z".=*+}" or "@@", but for each selected
			line. See |visual-repeat|. |default-mappings|
```

...though Justin may have his own opinion on this. :innocent:
(Maybe the `like "@..." or "@@"` bit can be omitted if the implication that it's related to those commands is deemed strong enough)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,7 +135,10 @@ q			Stops recording.
 
 							*@*
 @{0-9a-z".=*+}		Execute the contents of register {0-9a-z".=*+} [count]
-			times.  Note that register '%' (name of the current
+			times. In visual mode, repeat the previous @{0-9a-z":*} for
+			each selected line.

comment_data.body:
This may be a bit nitty of me, but I feel like this section ought to be clear that this is describing a mapping.
I also feel the wording can be improved; e.g: "calling" is a term usually reserved for functions.

I made a quick attempt to improve this below: (I'm still slightly unhappy with it; it's a tad verbose?)

```suggestion
Visual mode |default-mappings| "@" and "Q" can repeat commands in a register
for all selected lines. See |v_@-default| and |v_Q-default| for details. For
example, given the text:

	123(hello)321
	456(world)654
	456(NOT THIS)654

With register "x" containing the commands "yi(VP", Visually selecting the
first two lines and typing "@x" produces:

	hello
	world
	456(NOT THIS)654
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -366,6 +366,19 @@ one of the last commands to extend the highlighted text, the repeating will
 be applied up to the rightmost column of the longest line.  Any count passed
 to the `.` command is not used.
 
+With registers, apply the desired register to each line selected in Visual mode.
+For example:
+
+	123(hello)321
+	456(world)654
+	456(NOT THIS)654
+
+Having a register `@x` containing the following feed `yi(VP`, visually selecting the
+first two lines and calling `@x`, the output will be as follows:
+
+	hello
+	world
+	456(NOT THIS)654

comment_regular_data.body:
> I'm not sure of what the right place would be (maybe an example in the docs?), but I think that a "motivational example" that shows the power of this new feature might help people that want to use it. As someone that regularly uses macros, I'm still a bit lost after reviewing this PR about how this impacts me as a Neovim user.

I agree that it could be useful to have an example. Regarding the suggestion of using doc, the Q and @ docs are in the `runtime/doc/repeat.txt`. Maybe creating a `visual repeat` section for this matter, showing then an example would be suitable? 

```
==============================================================================
Visual mode repeats					*visual-repeat*

Apply the desired register to each line selected in visual mode.
For example:

	123(hello)321
	456(world)654
	456(not selected)654

Having a register `@x` containing the following feed `yi(VP`.
By visually selecting the first two lines and applying `@x`,
the output will be as follows:

	hello
	world
	456(not selected)654
```

_PS: i did not specified which visual mode, given that it should be applicable in all V-modes_
Please @MariaSolOs , let me know if this improves the comprehensive side of the PR.

> I agree that it could be useful to have an example. Regarding the suggestion of using doc, the Q and @ docs are in the `runtime/doc/repeat.txt`. Maybe creating a `visual repeat` section for this matter, showing then an example would be suitable?
> 
> ```
> ==============================================================================
> Visual mode repeats					*visual-repeat*
> 
> Apply the desired register to each line selected in visual mode.
> For example:
> 
> 	123(hello)321
> 	456(world)654
> 	456(not selected)654
> 
> Having a register `@x` containing the following feed `yi(VP`.
> By visually selecting the first two lines and applying `@x`,
> the output will be as follows:
> 
> 	hello
> 	world
> 	456(not selected)654
> ```

LGTM! This makes it much clearer :)

> LGTM! This makes it much clearer :)

Just in case, I saw there is already a `visual-repeat` section in docs, in [visual.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/529498685bbcd4783bc0e816d6247118c9ffb9a7/runtime/doc/visual.txt#L355). I'll be adding the example mentioned in this section
